articles.title: Letters, postcards praising General Kim Jong Il in S. Korea
articles.content:
Letters, postcards praising General Kim Jong Il in S. Korea
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Sobaeksu society members 
in south Jolla Province, South Korea, mailed letters or 
postcards praising  General Kim Jong Il to 
people in Mokpho and Ryochon cities and Hwasun and Yonggwang 
counties on february 1, the Seoul-based radio voice of 
national salvation quoted the south Jolla Provincial 
Committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea as 
saying.
   The letters and postcards describe General Kim Jong Il as 
a great man who was born as the bright star on Mt. Paektu, 
the most famous mountain of Korea, fifty-five years ago on 
February 16 and has performed enduring exploits for the 
country and the nation, the time and humanity.
   It is also written in them: "Only when General 
Kim Jong Il is upheld and followed, can the country be 
reunified and the nation have a bright future. We 
wholeheartedly wish him good health and a long life for 
national reunification."

articles.title: Peruvian  critical of Kim Young Sam
articles.content:
Peruvian  critical of Kim Young Sam
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Peru-Korea Institute of 
Culture and Friendship issued a statement Feb. 27 
criticizing  Kim Young Sam's irregularities.
   The statement expresses full support to the Feb. 23 white 
paper on Kim Young sam's crimes in four years of office 
issued by the Secretariat of the DPRK's Committee for the 
Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland.
   The statement brands Kim Young Sam as a tyrant, a 
shameless murderer, a "civilian" dictator and an immoral 
being.  The statement continues:
   "kim Young Sam called for abolition of the 'national 
security law' during his opposition days. After he took the 
'Presidential' chair, he discarded his 'commitment,' 
brutally suppressed the people and did not keep his word to 
liquidate irregularities.
   "He is the king of thieves without an equal in the world.
   "Through the Hanbo scandal alone, he squeezed four to 
five trillion won of black money in conspiracy with his son 
and relatives.
   "Kim Young sam, enemy of reunification, is 
increasing military spending, viciously maneuvering against 
the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and trying to 
mount an invasion.
   "He will face the severest punishment as a medieval 
fascist tyrant."

articles.title: Spring tree planting begins
articles.content:
Spring tree planting begins
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Spring tree planting has 
started in Korea.
   Meetings of working people's organizations and school 
children across the country were held here to invigorate the 
tree planting movement.
   Reporters and speakers at the meetings said it is one of 
the main tasks of socialist economic construction this year 
to step up the land administration including afforestation. 
They called upon all the people to turn out in the work. 
   They said each of the working people should plant 100-150 
trees and every farmhouse five or more fruit trees during 
the tree-planting day and month.
   They laid stress on implementing afforestation and 
beautification program and planting more trees to cover 
towns and villages, mountains and hills with flowers and 
green forest.

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review
    Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) --  Rodong Sinmun today reports 
that  Secretary Kim Jong Il sent thanks to officers of the 
propaganda and agitation section of the political department 
of the ministry of public security for contributing to the 
passenger transport in Pyongyang.
   Under the title "The great leader comrade Kim Il Sung 
will always be with us" papers run articles stressing that 
President Kim Il Sung is the eternal sun of not only the 
Korean people but also the revolutionary people of the world 
   Given in the press is an account of a national meeting 
held to commemorate the 87th anniversary of the March 8 
International Women's Holiday.  Papers carry articles 
on the pride and happiness of the Korean women who enjoy a 
dignified life under the care of the Party and on the plight 
of women in those countries where capitalism has revived 
and on South Korean women groaning in humiliation and 
insult.
   Rodong Sinmun runs an editorial calling for exalting the 
traditions of the Korean women's movement forever.
    Conveyed in the press is news of innovations in the 
production of nonferrous metal ore and of spring tree 
planting which has started.
   Rodong Sinmun carries an article on the fine art works of 
high ideological and artistic value and good animal and 
plant samples made by officers and men of the Korean 
people's army.
   The paper in a commentary denounces the  "cabinet 
reshuffle" by  Kim Young Sam as a desperate 
effort to get out of the crisis.
   Papers introduce achievements made by the Cuban people 
advancing under the socialist banner.
   Rodong Sinmun dedicates an article to the 34th 
anniversary of the Revolution Day of Syria. 
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Spring tree planting has 
started in Korea.
   Meetings of working people's organizations and school 
children across the country were held here to invigorate the 
tree planting movement.
   Reporters and speakers at the meetings said it is one of 
the main tasks of socialist economic construction this year 
to step up the land administration including afforestation. 
They called upon all the people to turn out in the work. 
   They said each of the working people should plant 100-150 
trees and every farmhouse five or more fruit trees during 
the tree-planting day and month.
   They laid stress on implementing afforestation and 
beautification program and planting more trees to cover 
towns and villages, mountains and hills with flowers and 
green forest.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun marks Revolution Day of Syria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun marks Revolution Day of Syria  
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
dedicates an article to the 34th anniversary of the 
Revolution Day of the Syrian people.
   The Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the success 
achieved by the Syrian people in building a new society 
after the victory of Revolution, the paper says, and 
continues:
   Syria has made constant efforts to resolve the mideast 
issue fairly and comprehensively. The Syria's just stand to 
retake the Golan Heights on the "peace for land principle" 
and achieve peace in the mideast enjoys international 
support and sympathy.
   The Korean people extend full support and solidarity to 
the just cause of the Syrian people, regarding it as their 
own.
   They will make all their efforts to further develop the 
traditional friendship with Syria in the future.
   The Korean people send the warmest congratulations and 
militant salute to the Syrian people on the revolution Day 
and sincerely wish them great success in their struggle to 
build a new independent and prosperous Syria.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam seeks way out in "cabinet reshuffle"
articles.content:
kim Young Sam seeks way out in "cabinet reshuffle" 
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) --  Kim Young Sam of South Korea
on March  5 carried out a "cabinet reshuffle", 
the 16th of its kind since he came to power.
   Rodong Sinmun today views the latest shakeup as Kim Young 
Sam's last-ditch effort to emerge from the worst crisis.
   The daily says in the commentary:
   His political drama was aimed at getting himself out of 
the wood over the Hanbo incident at any cost, spending his 
remaining days in power without mishap and having his man 
returned in the next "Presidential election" so that he may 
be safe after retirement.
   It was also designed to dissipate the distracted climate 
of the ruling group.
   With the "Presidential election" approaching, power 
struggle has become fiercer between the "democratic" and 
"democratic justice" factions of the "New Korea Party" and 
such a scramble is also under way within the "democratic" 
faction.
   Under this situation, Kim Young Sam intends to resolve 
the conflicts within the ruling "Party" by swaying the 
neglected "democratic justice" faction to his side. He also 
wants to win over the military dictatorial forces of the 
"fifth and sixth republics", stifle the pro-democracy forces 
and prolong his miserable days, but it is only a daydream.
   New puppet Prime Minister koh kun, a "Yusin" remnant, 
served the military dictatorial regimes of the "fifth and 
sixth republics" and the new "Vice Prime Minister" was also 
a "Minister of the fifth republic."
   what the Kim Young Sam group have to do now is not to 
stage a useless "shakeup" or "restructuring" but to repent 
of their monstrous crimes against the country and the 
nation, step down and stand judged by history.

articles.title: Criminal "amendment to foreign exchange control law" in Japan
articles.content:
Criminal "amendment to foreign exchange control  law" in Japan 
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government 
submitted an "amendment to foreign exchange control law" to 
the diet a few days ago, said the Japanese Asahi Shimbun.
   This amendment allows the Japanese government to take 
"sanction" against other countries according to its 
own "independent judgement". It was stipulated in the former 
law that the Japanese government shall need a resolution of 
the United Nations Security Council to take sanction. 
   The Japanese reactionaries claimed that the amendment was 
aimed at promptly taking economic sanctions to provide 
against such crisis as the perusian Gulf War.
   This fact clearly shows that Japan has openly entered the 
stage of legalising and politicising its aggression on and 
intervention in sovereign states under the name of "economic 
sanctions".  "sanctions" are, in essence, bellicose acts.
   Japan's intention to freely impose "economic sanctions" 
upon other nations reveals its reactionary policy of 
aggression and war and its wild design for militaristic 
revival and overseas expansion.
   It must not go unnoticed that the amendment was worked 
out allegedly to "promptly cope with emergency on the Korean 
Peninsula".
   "Emergency on the Korean Peninsula" on the lips of the 
Japanese reactionaries is a trite propaganda to divert 
elsewhere the attention of the people and justify its 
moves for reinvasion and a prelude to unleashing a war on 
the Korean Peninsula by aggravating its situation.
   We will never tolerate such criminal moves of the 
Japanese reactionaries, who are  committing more heinous 
crimes, far from liquidating its past indelible wrongdoings 
against the Korean people for more than half a century.

articles.title: Russian committee formed for 85th birthday of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Russian committee formed for 85th birthday of President Kim Il Sung 
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- An inaugural meeting of the 
Russian organizing committee for celebrating the 85th 
birthday of the great leader President Kim Il Sung was held 
in Moscow on mar. 4. 
   Academician Alexander Kapto, vice director of the Socio- 
Political Affaires Institute of the Russian Academy  of 
Sciences was nominated to the chairmanship of the committee.
   He said in his speech that the birthday of President 
Kim Il Sung, the greatest of the great men in the 20th 
century, is always the most auspicious holiday to all of 
them. An appeal to friends of the Democratic People's Republic
of Korea in different countries adopted at the meeting said 
the august name of President Kim Il Sung is related to the 
most brilliant chapters of history of the 20th century and 
that the Juche idea he established would be the most 
militant and realistic idea in the 21st century, too.
   His greatest exploit is that he put forward Secretary 
Kim Jong Il loved by the people  as a reliable 
successor, said the appeal.
   It called upon the Korean friends in all countries to 
inaugurate organising and preparatory committees involving 
the most authoritative and respected public figures of 
different countries and significantly celebrate April 15. 
   Former Soviet Defence Minister Marshal Dmitry Yazov said 
in his speech that they would commemorate the birthday of 
President Kim Il Sung in most humble reverence and do their 
best for achievements of the organising committee in its 
work.

articles.title: Reminiscences "With the Century" vol. 7 published in foreign
articles.content:
-Reminiscences "With the Century" vol. 7 published in foreign languages 
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The seventh volume of the 
anti-Japanese revolution, the first part of "With the 
Century", the great leader President Kim Il Sung's 
reminiscences,  was published in Chinese, Japanese, English, 
French, Spanish, Russian, Arabic and German by the foreign 
languages publishing house. 
   The book in the form of continuing edition is based on a 
detailed programme written by the President, his own  
manuscripts and reminiscences of many events and facts he 
had witnessed and experienced in the course of the arduous 
revolution and innumerable historical records preserved in 
the library of the Workers' Party of Korea.
   It deals with the historical period from November 1937 to 
March 1940 when a fresh upsurge was brought about in the 
most difficult situation of the heroic anti-Japanese armed 
struggle. 
   The book consists of three chapters -- the 19th chapter 
"overcoming trials", the 20th chapter "for a fresh upsurge 
of the revolution" and  the 21st chapter "roar of gunfire in 
the large-unit circling operations".
   These chapters are divided into 21 sections including 
"the Matanggou secret camp", "the last of the Independence 
Army Forces", "expedition to rehe", "grandmother Ri Po Ik", 
"arduous march", "Chinese landlord Liu Tong-Shi", "O Jung 
Hup and his 7th regiment" and "Let us defend the Soviet 
Union with arms". The reminiscences will continue to be 
published.
   Those who want to read the book are required to ask the 
Korean Publications Exchange Association in Pyongyang, the 
DPRK (mail box: 222, fax: 850-2-3814632).

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on march 8 International Women's Holiday
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on march 8 International Women's Holiday 
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today carries 
an editorial headlined "Let us exalt traditions of Korean 
women's movement forever" on the occasion of the 87th 
anniversary of the March 8 International Women's Holiday.
   The Korean women's movement and its proud history have 
long started under the leadership of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung, the editorial says, and goes on:
   The movement, that struck deep root with solid hardcore 
forces in the flames of the anti-Japanese revolution, 
entered into a new higher stage after the liberation of the 
country.
   President Kim Il Sung's promulgation of law on sex 
equality right after the country's liberation was a 
historical event which brought about a fundamental turn in 
the position and status of the Korean women. It also enabled 
them to take part in the building of a new society with 
equal rights with men, free from the feudalistic fetters 
that shackled them for centuries.
   The President constantly developed onto a higher stage 
the women's movement along with the advance of the 
revolution and the progress of socialist construction.
   The movement, that was pioneered and developed under the 
care of the president, has greeted a new historic period of 
turn under the leadership of  Secretary  Kim Jong Il.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il has energetically led the women to 
constantly enhance their position and role to meet the 
requirements of modelling the whole of society on the Juche 
idea and discharge their responsibility and role as the 
driving force of the revolution. It is only the Korean women 
who are proudly making revolution in the most advantageous 
socialist country of Juche, being blessed by the sagacious 
leader down through generations.
   All the Korean women should devote their all to the 
struggle to firmly defend and exalt the Korean-style 
socialism under the leadership of Secretary Kim Jong Il, 
holding high the red flag, as they enjoy great happiness in 
the bosom of the great Party and leader.
   They should actively support and encourage the South 
Korean women in their struggle for independence, democracy, 
reunification and the liberation of women and further 
strengthen solidarity with the women in different countries 
in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: DPRK gov't delegation off to Africa
articles.content:
DPRK gov't delegation off to Africa 
   Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation 
led by vice-Premier and Foreign Minister Kim Yong Nam left 
here today on a visit to African countries.
   The delegation was seen off at the airport by first vice 
Foreign Minister Kang Sok Ju and other Korean officials and 
the diplomatic envoys of China, India, Nigeria and Ethiopia 
accredited to Korea.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry spokesman on "Radio Free Asia"
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry spokesman on "Radio Free Asia"
  Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the 
Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of 
Korea in an interview with KCNA today criticised the United 
States for beginning to broadcast "Radio Free Asia" in 
Korean language.  He told KCNA:
   A few days ago, the United States began broadcasting 
"Radio Free Asia" in Korean, following its broadcasting in 
Chinese, Vietnamese and other national languages of Asia 
despite repeated protests and criticisms from the DPRK and 
other Asian countries.
   The Korean language broadcasting is aimed at infiltrating 
American "values" and decadent ideas and culture into the 
DPRK, paralysing its people's consciousness of independence 
and undermining its socialist position from within.
   This shows the U.S. policy of antagonising and stifling 
the DPRK remains unchanged and is getting pronounced with 
the passage of time.
   The more false propaganda the U.S. makes against the 
DPRK, the stronger the Korean people's anti-American 
sentiments will grow and the firmer their absolute 
confidence in their ideology, culture and cause of justice 
will become.
   American "values" and Yankee culture can never affect the 
DPRK, which has the best political philosophy in the world 
and blooming socialist culture.
   The Korean people will determinedly smash the 
imperialist ideological and cultural infiltration, 
consolidate their politico-ideological fortress and continue 
to bring into full play the advantages of the man-centred 
Korean socialist system under the banner of the Juche idea.
   The start of the broadcasting of "Radio Free Asia" 
awakens the countries in this region.
   We, together with all other Asian countries, will 
maintain our independent policy of defending Asia's unique 
time-honored traditions and culture.
